heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 29 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (190°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 1.8°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 3.1°C), dew point temperature (up 2.6°C), cloud levels (up 122 m), and outside temperature (up 2.9°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 57.1m higher than yesterday, 42.1m lower than the past week, 121.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 869m minimum and 1350m maximum, with an average of 1157.6m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1199.7m and 1279.4m.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, pleasant humidity levels and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and some sunny spells will occur. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (92%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
